text: Rolf-Dieter Amend (born 21 March 1949 in Magdeburg, Saxony-Anhalt) is a former East German slalom canoeist who competed in the 1970s. He won a gold in the C-2 event at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich. Amend also won three medals at the ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships with two golds (C-2 team: 1971, 1975) and a silver (C-2: 1971). ==References== * * Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Magdeburg Category:German male canoeists Category:Sportspeople from Saxony-Anhalt Category:Olympic canoeists of East Germany Category:Canoeists at the 1972 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists for East Germany Category:Olympic medalists in canoeing Category:Medalists at the 1972 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships Category:Recipients of the Patriotic Order of Merit in silver
title: Rolf-Dieter Amend
